page.title: 15CHISWELL GREEN
page.content: {Chiswell Green}is called a 'village' although on the map it seems to be part of St.Albans. The village has, in fact, very definite boundaries and a strong sense of identity. There is an active, non-political,{Residents {Association}which looks after the general well being of the area and run a variety of functions throughout the year. They have organised a system of road stewards who may be called upon should someone be in need of help or advice and they produce a newsleter quarterly to keep the residents informed. The school and church provide the main meeting places either for discussion or social events. The shopping area is centrally placed and most daily requirements are catered for.There are three{recreation areas providing play, sport and allotment facilities.
